item.name: Generated Report
Generated Report - Data
item.description:
`generated_report.attributes.data` contains attributes that represent the generated data for the given`report_type`. See below for the attributes for each `report_type`. ### Agent Report Data | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `agent_information` | object | `agent_information` is an object that contains information about the specific `agent` the `generated_report` was created for. | **No** | | `from_ts` | number | The beginning point in time of when the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **No** | | `incidents_daily` | array\[object\] | `incidents_daily` contains which hours an `incident` occurred in. This is only provided if the time range of `from_ts` and `to_ts` is >= 4 days or <= 30 days. | **No** | | `incidents_hourly` | array\[object\] | `incidents_hourly` contains which hours an `incident` occurred in. This is only provided if the time range of `from_ts` and `to_ts` is less than 4 days. | **No** | | `incidents_monthly` | array\[object\] | `incident_montly` contains which days an `incident` occurred in. This is only provided if the time range of `from_ts` and `to_ts` is greater than 30 days. | **No** | | `targets` | array\[object\] | `targets` high level information for each `target` as well as test averages and alert counts that the specified `agent` is assigned to. | **No** | | `target_test_performance_dns` | array\[object\] | `target_test_perfomrance_dns` contains statistical timeseries data based on `from_ts` and `to_ts`. | **No** | | `target_test_performance_http` | array\[object\] | `target_test_perfomrance_http` contains statistical timeseries data based on `from_ts` and `to_ts`. | **No** | | `target_test_performance_ping` | array\[object\] | `target_test_perfomrance_ping` contains statistical timeseries data based on `from_ts` and `to_ts`. | **No** | | `target_test_performance_traceroute` | array\[object\] | `target_test_perfomrance_traceroute` contains statistical timeseries data based on `from_ts` and `to_ts`. | **No** | | `to_ts` | number | The ending point in time of where the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **No** | | `wifi_performance` | array\[object\] | `wifi_performance` contains statistical timeseries data based on `access_point_connections`. This is only provided if the `agent` is a `wireless` `agent`. | **No** | ### Network Status Report Data | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `agents` | array\[object\] | `agents` contains high level information as well as average network speedtest data and alert counts for each `agent` included in the `generated_report`. | **No** | | `from_ts` | number | The begnning point in time of where the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **No** | | `targets` | array\[object\] | `targets` contains high level information as well as average value for each test type and alert counts for each `target` included in the `generated_report`. | **No** | | `to_ts` | number | The ending point in time of where the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **No** | ### Target Report Data | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `target_information` | object | `target_information` is an object that contains information about the specific `target` the `generated_report` was created for. | **No** | | `from_ts` | number | The begnning point in time of where the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **No** | | `incidents_daily` | array\[object\] | `incidents_daily` contains which hours an `incident` occurred in. This is only provided if the time range of `from_ts` and `to_ts` is >= 4 days or <= 30 days. | **No** | | `incidents_hourly` | array\[object\] | `incidents_hourly` contains which hours an `incident` occurred in. This is only provided if the time range of `from_ts` and `to_ts` is less than 4 days. | **No** | | `incidents_monthly` | array\[object\] | `incident_montly` contains which days an `incident` occurred in. This is only provided if the time range of `from_ts` and `to_ts` is greater than 30 days. | **No** | | `agents` | array\[object\] | `agents` contains high level information as well as test averages and alert counts for each `agent` that is attached to the specified `target`. | **No** | | `agent_alerts` | array\[object\] | `agent_alerts` contains `alerts` of all attached `agents`. | **No** | | `agent_test_performance_dns` | array\[object\] | `agent_test_perfomrance_dns` contains statistical timeseries data based on `from_ts` and `to_ts`. | **No** | | `agent_test_performance_http` | array\[object\] | `agent_test_perfomrance_http` contains statistical timeseries data based on `from_ts` and `to_ts`. | **No** | | `agent_test_performance_ping` | array\[object\] | `agent_test_perfomrance_ping` contains statistical timeseries data based on `from_ts` and `to_ts`. | **No** | | `agent_test_performance_traceroute` | array\[object\] | `agent_test_perfomrance_traceroute` contains statistical timeseries data based on `from_ts` and `to_ts`. | **No** | | `to_ts` | number | The ending point in time of where the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **No** | ### Scheduled Test Report Parameters | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `agents` | array\[objects\] | `agents` contains high level information for each `agent` included in the `generated_report`. | **No** | | `scheduled_tests` | number | `scheduled_tests` contains high level information for each `scheduled_test` included in the `generated_report`. | **No** | | `warning_occurrences` | array\[object\] | `warning_occurrences` contains any occurrences where `warning_conditions` of a `scheduled_tests` were met. | **No** | | `isp_aggregates` | array\[object\] | `isp_aggregates` contains aggregate result infomation per ISP. | **No** | | `quality_per_isp` | | `quality_per_isp` contains aggregate counts of the quality of each ISP based on thresholds. | **No** | | `results` | array\[object\] | `results` contains statistical timeseries data based on `from_ts` and `to_ts` | **No** | | `from_ts` | number | The beginning point in time of where the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **No** | | `to_ts` | number | The ending point in time of when the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **Yes**
Optional unless `time_period` is `custom`, must be a unix epoch timestamp. |

item.name: Generated Report - Parameters
item.description:
`generated_report.attributes.parameters` contains attributes that define how the specified `report_type` should be created. See below for the valid attributes for each `report_type`. ### Agent Report Parameters | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `agents` | number | The `id` of the `agent` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Must contain a valid `agent` `id`. | | `from_ts` | number | The beginning point in time of when the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **Yes**
Optional unless `time_period` is `custom`, must be a unix epoch timestamp. | | `time_period` | number | The `id` of the `agent` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Required, must be one of the following values:
\- `custom`
\- `today`
\- `last_7_days`
\- `last_30_days`
\- `last_90_days`
\- `last_week`
\- `last_month`
\- `last_3_months`
\- `last_quarter` | | `to_ts` | number | The ending point in time of when the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **Yes**
Optional unless `time_period` is `custom`, must be a unix epoch timestamp. | ### Network Status Report Parameters | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `agents` | array\[number\] | An array of `ids` of the `agents` that are included in the `generated_report`. | **Yes**
Must by an array of valid `agent` `ids`. | | `agent_groups` | number | The `id` of the `agent_groups` in which an `agent_group` assigned `agents` will the included in the `generated_report`. | **Yes**
Must be an array of valid `agent_group` `ids`. | | `from_ts` | number | The beginning point in time of when the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **Yes**
Optional unless `time_period` is `custom`, must be a unix epoch timestamp. | | `targets` | array\[number\] | An array of `ids` of the `targets` that are included in the `generated_report`. | **Yes**
Must by an array of valid `target` `ids`. | | `time_period` | number | The `id` of the `agent` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Required, must be one of the following values:
\- `custom`
\- `today`
\- `last_7_days`
\- `last_30_days`
\- `last_90_days`
\- `last_week`
\- `last_month`
\- `last_3_months`
\- `last_quarter` | | `to_ts` | number | The ending point in time of when the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **Yes**
Optional unless `time_period` is `custom`, must be a unix epoch timestamp. | ### Target Report Parameters | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `from_ts` | number | The beginning point in time of when the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **Yes**
Optional unless `time_period` is `custom`, must be a unix epoch timestamp. | | `targets` | number | The `id` of the `target` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Require, must contain a valid `target` `id`. | | `time_period` | number | The `id` of the `agent` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Required, must be one of the following values:
\- `custom`
\- `today`
\- `last_7_days`
\- `last_30_days`
\- `last_90_days`
\- `last_week`
\- `last_month`
\- `last_3_months`
\- `last_quarter` | | `to_ts` | number | The ending point in time of when the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **Yes**
Optional unless `time_period` is `custom`, must be a unix epoch timestamp. | ### Scheduled Test Report Parameters | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `agent` | number | The `id` of the `agent` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Required if `scheduled_tests` is not provided, must contain a valid `agent` `id`. | | `from_ts` | number | The beginning point in time of when the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **Yes**
Optional unless `time_period` is `custom`, must be a unix epoch timestamp. | | `scheduled_tests` | number | The `id` of the `scheduled_nb_test_template` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Required if `agent` is not provided, must contain a valid `scheduled_nb_test_template` `id`. | | `time_period` | number | The `id` of the `agent` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Required, must be one of the following values:
\- `custom`
\- `today`
\- `last_7_days`
\- `last_30_days`
\- `last_90_days`
\- `last_week`
\- `last_month`
\- `last_3_months`
\- `last_quarter` | | `to_ts` | number | The ending point in time of when the `generated_report` data is generated from. | **Yes**
Optional unless `time_period` is `custom`, must be a unix epoch timestamp. | | `test_type_id` | number | The `id` of the `test_type` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Required, must be one of the following values:
\- `5` (iPerf)
\- `7` (Network speedtest)
\- `8` (VoIP) |

A `generated_report` represents a report that was created either from a `scheduled_report` or by a `user` requesting it ad-hoc. ### Attributes | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `name` | string | User-defined attribute to help identify the `generated_report` | **Yes**
Required, `name` must be no longer than 255 characters. | | `report_type` | string | The type of report the `generated_report` was specified as. | **Yes**
Required , `report_type` must be one of the following options:
\- `agent`
\- `network_status`
\- `target`
\- `scheduled_test`
\- `weekly_status` | | `state` | string | `state` where the `generated_report` is during the generation process. The `states` are as follows:
\- `created`: The `generated_report` has been created and queued to have the report data generated.
\- `processing`: The `generated_report` is in the process of generating the report data based on the provided `parameters` and `report_type`.
\- `generated`: The report generation process has completed. | **No** | | `parameters` | object | All user-supplied criteria that were used to create the `generated_report`. | **Yes**
See [Generated Report - Parameters ](#folder-400f2958-ad62-474a-8cde-215178eda03f) for `report_type` specific attributes. | | `data` | string | The generated `data` of the `generated_report`. This attribute is only available when retrieving a specific report using the report's unique `id` | **No**
See [Generated Report - Data](#folder-2beb1a71-4ff6-4dc8-a5c0-e56a206ca577) for information regarding individual `report_type` data. | | `created_at` | datetime | The timestamp of when the `generated_report` was created. | **No** | | `updated_at` | datetime | The timestamp of when the `generated_report` was last updated. | **No** | ### Relationships | Relationship | One or Many | Optional? | | --- | --- | --- | | `scheduled_report` | One | **Yes** | | `user` | One | **Yes** |

item.name: Grouped Alert Count
item.description:
A `grouped_alert_count` represents the number of alerts by severity per `agent`.

### Attributes

| Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `name` | string | The name of the `agent`. | **No** |
| `counts_grouped_by_severity` | object | When `severity` is chosen as the `group` parameter, then this object will consist of key/value pairs where the key is severity `1` for `critical` alerts, or `4` for `warning` alerts. | **No** |
| `counts_grouped_by_alert_detector` | object | When `alert_detector_id` is chosen as the `group` parameter, then this object will consist of key/value pairs where the key is the alert detector's ID. | **No** |

item.name: HTTP Result
item.description:
An `http_result` represents the recorded value of a `http_test` that was run by an `agent`.

### Attributes

| **Attribute** | **Data Type** | **Description** | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| value | number | The `value` of the test result. | **No** |
| network_interface_type | string | The `network_interface_type` of the test `result`. | **No** |
| error_code | number | If an error occurred during the test then the `error_code` will be given. | **No** |
| ts | number | An epoch timestamp of when the `result` occurred. | **No** |

### Relationships

| Relationship | **One or Many** | **Optional?** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `agent` | One | **No** |
| `nb_test_template` | One | **No** |
| `wifi_profile` | One | **Yes** |

item.name: HTTP Test
item.description:
A `http_test` represents the configuration that is used when an `agent` tests HTTP.

### Attributes

| Attribute | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `http_method` | string | Indicates the HTTP method to be used. Currently only `GET` is supported. | **No** |
| `proxy_protocol` | string | Specifies if HTTP or HTTPS will be used with the configured proxy. | **No** |
| `proxy_address` | string | Specifies the proxy IP address or URL to be used for the `http_test`. | **No** |
| `proxy_port` | string | Specifies the port the configured proxy can be reached on. | **No** |
| `proxy_authentication_username` | string | The `username` to be used to authenticate with the proxy should the proxy require authentication. | **No** |
| `proxy_authentication_password` | string | The `password` to be used to authenticate with the proxy should the proxy require authentication. | **No** |
| `authentication_type` | string | Specifies optional authentication for specified `nb_test` `target`. Supported options are Basic and NTML. | **No** |
| `authentication_username` | string | The `username` to be used to authenticate. | **No** |
| `authentication_password` | string | The `password` to be used to authenticate. | **No** |

### Relationship

| Relationship | **One or Many** | Optional? |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `nb_test` | One | **No** |

item.name: Incident
item.description:
An `incident` represents a detected problem with an `agent` based on a configured threshold of `alerts`.

### Attributes

| Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `ack_ts` | number | The unix epoch timestamp of when the `incident` was acknowledged by a `user`. | **No** |
| `created_at` | string | The timestamp of when the `incident` was created. | **No** |
| `end_ts` | string | The unix epoch timestamp of when the `incident` end. | **No** |
| `start_ts` | string | The unix epoch timestamp of when the `incident` started. | **No** |
| `updated_at` | string | The timestamp of when the `incident` was last updated. | **No** |

### Relationships

| Relationship | One or Many | Optional? |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `agents` | One | **No** |
| `incident_detector` | One | **No** |
| `incident_logs` | Many | **Yes** |

item.name: Iperf Test
item.description:
A `ipref_test` represents the configuration that is used when an `agent` tests Iperf.

### Attributes

| Attribute | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `iperf_type` | number | Indicates if the IPerf test will be done via UDP (2) or TCP (3). | **No** |
| `iperf_time` | number | Specifies the duration of the `iperf_test` in seconds. | **No** |
| `iperf_port` | number | The indicated port the `iperf_test` will use to connect to. | **No** |
| `tcp_window` | number | If `iperf_type` is TCP `tcp_window` indicates the TCP window size in megabytes. | **No** |
| `bandwidth` | number | Indicates the speed limit that should be imposed on the IPerf test. `null` would indicate max throughput. | **No** |
| `multicast` | boolean | If `iperf_type` is UDP this specifies if `multicast` should be used. | **No** |
| `multicast_ip` | string | If `iperf_type` is UDP and `multicast` is enabled this specifies if `multicast` group address. | **No** |
| `ttl` | number | Indicates the `multicast` TTL. | **No** |
| `tos` | number | Specifies the TOS DSCP/PHB class. | **No** |
| `parallel_streams` | number | If `iperf_type` is UDP, this indicates the number of `parallel_streams` to be used during the `iperf_test`. | **No** |
| `iperf_version` | number | Indicates the version of IPerf the test should use. | **No** |
| `reverse` | boolean | Indicates the direction of the IPerf test between its sources and destination. | **No** |

item.name: Monitoring Condition
item.description:
A `monitoring_condition` consists of the following attributes: | Attribute | Data Type | **Description** | **User Defined?** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `name` | string | User-defined attribute to help identify an `monitoring_condition`. | **Yes**
Required, `name` must be provided and must be less than 255 characters. | | `conditions` | object | User-defined object that defines the conditions of the `monitoring_condition`. | **Yes**
Required, `conditions` must be in JSONLogic format. See options below. | ### Condition Options | Condition Type | Attributes | | --- | --- | | `dns` | `dns_type` : Specifies condition should test using UDP or TCP.
Required, available options:
\- `1` (UDP)
\- `3` (TCP)

`target`: Specifies the destination that the test will use.
Required, must be a valid IP address or FQDN.

`dns_server`: Specifies the DNS server to be used.
Optional, must be a valid IP address or FQDN.

`expected`: Sepcifies the expected value of the test.
Optional, must be a valid IP address or FQDN. | | `vpn` | `expected`: Specifies if the VPN should be connected or not connected.
Required, must be one of the following options:
\- `true` (up)
\- `false` (down) | | `ssid` | `expected`: Specifies the expected ssid.
Required, must be a string. |

item.name: Multiagent Test Run
item.description:
A `multiagent_nb_test_run` consists of the following attributes: | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `ts` | number | The UNIX epoch timestamp in milliseconds of when the test corresponding to this run was executed. | **No** | | `state` | string | The current running state that this run is into at the moment of the request. The possible states can be one of `initialization`, `start-destination`, `start-sources`, `running`, `completed`, `failed`. | **No** | | `configuration` | object | Contains an object describing the configuration parameters of the test executed with this run. | **Yes**
Required, see | ### Relationships | Resource | One or Many | Optional? | | --- | --- | --- | | `agents` | Many | **No** | | `test_type` | One | **No** |

item.name: NbTest
item.description:
A `nb_test` consists of the following attributes: | Attribute | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `target` | string | The IP address or URL the `nb_test` will use to perform the test against. | **Yes**
`target` must be present unless `nb_test` is a scheduled test. | | `options` | object | Provides the configuration object of the `nb_test`. | **No** | | `count` | number | Specifies the number of `nb_test` iterations to be performed when `ad_hoc=true`. | **Yes**
`count` must be present and an integer equal to or greater than 0 unless `nb_test` is a scheduled test. | | `interval` | number | The number of seconds the `nb_test` should run for. | **Yes**
`interval` must be present and an integer greater than 0 unless `nb_test` is a scheduled test. | | `timeout` | number | The number of seconds to allow the `nb_test` to start obtaining results, otherwise the `nb_test` will indicate it has reached the timeout execution limit. | **Yes**
`timeout` must be present and an integer greater than or equal to -1 unless `nb_test`is a scheduled test. | | `start_ts` | timestamp | The timestamp of when the `nb_test` was initialized. | **No** | | `ad_hoc` | boolean | Indicates if the `nb_test` is an `ad_hoc` test. | **No** | | `scheduled_type` | string | Indicates if the `nb_test` is a `periodic` or `scheduled` test. | **No** | | `current_alert_mode` | string | Indicated the current alert mode of the `nb_test` and will be one of the following alert modes: `stopped`, `unknown`, `paused`, `fail`, `warning`, `success`. | **No** | | `created_at` | string | The timestamp of when the `nb_test` was created. | **No** | | `interface_type` | string | Specifies the `interface_type` of the `nb_test` and will be either `wired` or `wireless`. | **No** | | `current_state` | string | Indicated the current state of the `nb_test` and will be one of the following states: `initialization`, `running`, `paused`, `stop-requested`, `stopped`, `exception`, `change-requested`, `pause-requested`, `resume-requested`. | **No** | | `current_state_transition_ts` | number | The timestamp of when the `nb_test` entered the `current_state`. | **No** | ### Relationships | Relationship | **One or Many** | **Optional?** | | --- | --- | --- | | `test_type` | One | **No** | | `agent` | Many | **No** | | `network_interface` | Many | **No** | | `nb_test_template` | Many | **No** | A `nb_test` will also include one of the following relationships based on `test_type`. | Relationship | **One or Many** | **Optional?** | | --- | --- | --- | | `path_analysis_test` | One | **No** | | `ping_test` | One | **No** | | `dns_test` | One | **No** | | `http_test` | One | **No** | | `traceroute_test` | One | **No** | | `speedtest_test` | One | **No** | | `voip_test` | One | **No** | | `iperf_test` | One | **No** |

item.name: Network Interface
item.description:
An `network_interface` represents a single network interface of a given `agent`. An `agent` will have at least one `network_interface` and may have multiple interfaces. `network_interface` does not have any user defined attributes and cannot be modified through the API. ### Attributes | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `key` | string | The `network_interface` reporting interface id. | **No** | | `mac` | string | The `mac` address of the `network_interface`. | **No** | | `ip_address` | string | The reported IPv4 `ip_address` of the `network_interface`. | **No** | | `interface_type` | string | The type of `network_interface` determined by `key`. `interface_type` will be one of the following values:
\- `wired`
\- `wireless` | **No** | | `model` | string | The `model` of the `network_interface`. | **No** | | `vendor` | string | The manufacturer of the `network_interface`. | **No** | | `gateway` | string | The `gateway` of the `ip_address` obtained by the `network_interface`. | **No** | | `netmask` | string | The `netmask` of the `ip_address` obtained by the `network_interface`. | **No** | | `speed` | string | The `speed` of the `network_interface` based on the obtained network connection. | **No** | | `duplex` | string | The `duplex` of the `network_interface` based on the obtained network connection. | **No** | | `speed_duplex_is_auto` | boolean | Determines if the `network_interface` will auto-negotiate `speed` and `duplex`. | **No** | | `dhcp` | boolean | Determines if the `network_interface` obtained an `ip_address` via `dhcp`. | **No** | | `mtu` | number | The `mtu` of the `network_interface` based on the obtained network connection. | **No** | | `dns_server1` | string | The primary `dns_server` of the `network_interface` based on the obtained network connection. | **No** | | `dns_server2` | string | The secondary `dns_server` of the `network_interface` based on the obtained network connection. | **No** | | `connected` | boolean | Specifies if the `network_interface` is currently connected. | **No** | | `ipv6_address` | string | The reported IPv6 `ip_address` of the `network_interface`. | **No** | | `ipv6_enabled` | boolean | Specifies if the `network_interface` has IPv6 enabled. | **No** | | `external_ip` | string | The reported public `ip_address` of the `network_interface`. | | | `connected_since` | number | The reported epoch timestamp of when the `network_interface` connected. | **No** |

item.name: Path Analysis Result
Supplemental
item.description:
`supplemental` information for a `path_analsysi_result` consists of the following attributes:

| Attribute | Data Type | Description/Options | User Defined? |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `hostname` | string | `hostname` of the `destination` that was discovered. | **No** |
| `asn` | string | `asn` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |
| `asn_name` | string | `asn_name` for the `asn` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |
| `asn_type` | string | `asn_type` for the `asn` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |
| `asn_domain` | string | `asn_domain` for the `asn` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |
| `city` | string | `city` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |
| `region` | string | `region` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |
| `country` | string | `country` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |
| `postal_code` | string | `postal_code` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |
| `latitude` | number | `latitude` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |
| `longitude` | number | `longitude` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |
| `timezone` | string | `timezone` of the `destination` that was discovered based on IP address. | **No** |

A `path_analysis_result` consists of the following attributes:

| Attribute | Data Type | Description/Options | User Defined? |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `dest_port` | number | The destination port used for the `path_analysis_result`. | **No** |
| `destination` | boolean | Indicates if the `hop` is the intended destination. | **No** |
| `error_code` | number | If an error occurred during the `hop` then the `error_code` will be given. | **No** |
| `error_message` | string | If an error occurred during the `hop` and a message is available then a `error_message` will be given. | **No** |
| `hostname` | string | If an FQDN was resolved for the `hop` then `hostname` will be given. | **No** |
| `hop_number` | number | The corresponding `hop` number of the `path_analysis_result`. | **No** |
| `ip_address` | number | The `ip_address` reported by the `hop` source. | **No** |
| `natted` | boolean | Indicates if NAT was used during the `hop`. | **No** |
| `rtt` | number | The round trip time of the `hop` in milliseconds. | **No** |
| `ts` | number | An epoch timestamp of when the `path_analysis_result` occurred. | **No** |

### Relationships

| Relationship | **One or Many** | **Optional?** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `agent` | One | **No** |
| `nb_test_template` | One | **No** |
| `supplemental` | One | **No** |
| `wifi_profile` | One | **No** |

item.name: Path Analysis Test
item.description:
Below are the `options` if the `nb_test` `test_type` is `path_analysis`:

| Attribute | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `num_flows` | number | Specifies the number of flows that will be done during the test. | **No** |
| `source_port` | number | Specifies the port that should be used when performing the `path_anlaysis_test` from the `agent`. | **No** |
| `destination_port` | number | The indicated `port` the `path_analysis_test` will use to connect to. | **No** |
| `max_ttl` | number | Indicates the max number of hops to be attempted on each flow. | **No** |
| `min_ttl` | number | Indicates the minimum number of hops to be attempted on each flow. | **No** |
| `inter_packet_delay` | number | Specifies the number of milliseconds between each hop. | **No** |

item.name: Ping Result
item.description:
The following attributes of a `ping_result`:

| **Attribute** | **Data Type** | **Description** | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| value | number | The `value` of the test result. | **No** |
| network_interface_type | string | The `network_interface_type` of the test `result`. | **No** |
| error_code | number | If an error occurred during the test then the `error_code` will be given. | **No** |
| ts | number | An epoch timestamp of when the `result` occurred. | **No** |

A `result` also consists of the following relationships:

| Attribute | **One or Many** | **Optional?** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `agent` | One | **No** |
| `nb_test_template` | One | **No** |
| `wifi_profile` | One | **Yes** |

item.name: Ping Test
item.description:
Below are the `options` if the `nb_test` `test_type` is `ping_test`:

| Attributes | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `data_size` | number | Specifies the MTU size. | **No** |
| `dont_fragment` | boolean | Specifies if provided MTU should be sent fragmented. | **No** |
| `tos` | number | Specifies the TOS DSCP/PHB class. | **No** |
| `port` | number | The indicated `port` the `ping_test` will use to connect to. | **No** |
| `ping_type` | number | Indicates if the `ping_test` should use ICMP (2) or TCP (3). | **No** |
| `flags` | string | If `ping_type` is set to TCP this field will specify set flags. | **No** |
| `jitter_mos` | boolean | Indicates of `ping_test` should also calculate jitter and MOS scores. | **No** |
| `force_ipv6` | boolean | If enabled the test will attempt to use only IPv6 addresses of the FQDN target's DNS resolution. Otherwise it will use whatever is available. | **No** |

item.name: Scheduled Report
item.description:
A `scheduled_report` represents the criteria, `report_type`, and the schedule for which a `generated_report` will be created. ### Attributes | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `agent` | string | The `id` of the `agent` in which the `generated_report` will be generated for. | **Yes**
Optional unless `report_type` is `scheduled_test`, if `scheduled_tests` is not provided the `agent` must provided and must be a valid `agent` `id`. | | `agents` | array\[number\] | The `ids` of the `agents` in which the `generated_report` will be generated for. | **Yes**
Optional unless `report_type` is `agent` or `network_status`, then must provide an array of valid `agent` `ids`. | | `agent_groups` | array\[number\] | The `id` of the `agent_groups` in which an `agent_group` assigned `agents` will be included in the `generated_report`. | **Yes**
Optional unless `report_type` is `network_status`, then must provide an array of valid `agent_group` `ids`. | | `auto_subscribe` | boolean | Determines if when new `users` are added to the dashboard if they should automatically be added as a recipient of the `generated_report` when created by the `scheduled_report`. | **Yes**
Require, must be either `true` or `false`. | | `created_at` | string | The timestamp of when the `scheduled_report` was created. | **No** | | `created_by` | string | The `users` `name` of who created the `scheduled_report`. | **No** | | `cron_schedule` | string | The cron expression that dictates when the `scheduled_report` will create the `generated_report`. | **Yes**
Required, must be a valid cron expression. | | `paused` | boolean | Defines if the `scheduled_report` is currently running. | **Yes**
Required, must be either `true` or `false`. | | `paused_at` | string | The timestamp of when the `scheduled_report` was paused. | **No** | | `from_ts` | number | The beginning point in time of when the `generated_report` data will be generated in epoch format. | **No** | | `name` | string | User-defined `name` to help identify the created `scheduled_report`. | **Yes**
Required, `name` must be no longer than 255 characters. | | `report_type` | string | The type of report that was created. Currently the only `report_type` will be `network_status`. | **Yes**
Required, `report_type` must be one of the following options:
\- `agent`
\- `network_status`
\- `target`
\- `scheduled_test`
\- `weekly_status` | | `scheduled_tests` | string | The `id` of the `scheduled_nb_test_template` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Optional unless `report_type` is `scheduled_test`, if `agent` is not provided then `scheduled_tests` must be provided and must contain a valid `scheduled_nb_test_template` `id`. | | `system_report` | boolean | Defines if the `scheduled_report` is a `system_report` and is added by default by NetBeez. | **No** | | `targets` | array\[number\] | An array of `ids` of the `targets` that will be included in the `generated_report`. | **Yes**
Optional unless `report_type` is `network_status` or `target`, then must contain an array of valid `target` `ids`. | | `test_type_id` | string | Defines the `test_type_id` the `generated_report` will be created for. | **Yes**
Optional unless `report_type` is `scheduled_test`, then must be one of the following values:
\- `5` (iPerf)
\- `7` (Network speedtest)
\- `8` (VoIP) | | `thresholds` | string | For `scheduled_test` `report_type` this defines the thresholds in which results for `scheduled_tests` would be poor. | **No** | | `time_period` | string | The `id` of the `agent` in which the `generated_report` is generated for. | **Yes**
Required, must be one of the following values:
\- `custom`
\- `today`
\- `last_7_days`
\- `last_30_days`
\- `last_90_days`
\- `last_week`
\- `last_month`
\- `last_3_months`
\- `last_quarter` | | `to_ts` | number | The end point in time of when the `generated_report` data will be generated in epoch format. | **No** | | `updated_at` | string | The timestamp of when the `scheduled_report` was last updated. | **No** | ### Relationships | Relationship | **One or Many** | **Optional?** | | --- | --- | --- | | `contacts` | Many | **Yes** | | `user` | One | **No** |

item.name: Scheduled Test Results
item.description:
A `scheduled_test_result` consists of the following attributes:

| Attribute | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `error_message` | string | If a scheduled test run fails to produce results, an error message will be present in this attribute, describing the reason it failed. | **No** |
| `severity` | number | If the result is successful it will have severity `6`, if the metric violates the conditions set on the scheduled test template, then severity will be `4`, and if the test failed then severity will be `1`. | **No** |
| `ts` | number | The UNIX epoch timestamp in milliseconds of when the test corresponding to this result was run. | **No** |
| `ssid` | string | If the agent is wireless then this field will contain the SSID name of the wireless network the NetBeez agent was connected to when this test was run. | **No** |
| `result_values` | array | This contains objects with a `key` and `value` attributes, where `key` is the name of the metric, and `value` is a float number containing the value measured. | **No** |
| `violated_condition` | object | Contains an object describing the conditions violated if any which are set on the scheduled test template at the time the test corresponding to this result was run. | **No** |

item.name: Scheduled Test Run Statistics
item.description:
A `scheduled_test_result_average` consists of the following attributes:

| Attribute | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `ts` | number | The UNIX epoch timestamp in milliseconds when the group of tests corresponding to this average result was run. The system makes sure that results from a specific scheduled run are aligned to the triggered time. | **No** |
| `min_severity` | number | The minimum severity marked by the results corresponding to this average result. The severity is `1` if any of the tests fail, `4` if any of the tests had a condition violated but none failed to run, or `6` if all of the tests were successful. | **No** |
| `error_count` | number | The number of results in this result average that failed to run. | **No** |
| `warning_count` | number | The number of results in this result average that violated conditions. | **No** |
| `avg_result_values` | array | An array of objects with `key` and `value` attributes, where `key` is the metric name and `value` is the average value reported by all of the tests which ran at the same time. | **No** |

item.name: Scheduled Test Template
item.description:
A `scheduled_nb_test_template` consists of the following attributes: | Attribute | Data Type | Description/Options | **User Defined?** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `label` | string | User-defined attribute that defined the label given to the Scheduled test template. This is displayed in the scheduled tests lists and test details header. | **No** | | `target` | string | IP address or FQDN of the destination for this test. This could be an external Iperf server. For network speed and VoIP this can be set to `0.0.0.0`. | **No** | | `test_type_id` | number | The id number for the test type is one of the following:

\- Iperf: `5`
\- Network Speed: `7`
\- VoIP: `8` | **No** | | `cron_schedule` | string | The cron-style schedule that this test needs to follow. Please refer to [this article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron) for proper cron formatting. | **No** | | `agent_ids` | Array\[number\] | An array of source agent ids. If the test is agent-to-agent then this should only have 1 id. | **No** | | `warning_conditions` | JSON object | Set of conditions that when met by the result values those results will be flagged with a warning. The conditions follow the JSON logic format. To be used when familiar with the logic. The UI provides a component that generates this. | **No** | | `options` | object | This object includes attributes specific to the type of test this template represents. More details on this in the following paragraphs. | **No** | A `scheduled_test_template` will also include one of the following list of attributes based on `test_type`. ### Ipref | Attribute | Data Type | Description/Options | **User Defined?** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `iperf_type` | number | Specifies whether the Iperf test used TCP or UDP. | **Yes**
Required, `ipref_type` must be one of the following values:
\- `1` (TCP)
\- `2` (UDP) | | `iperf_time` | number | Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, each test iteration will run for. | **Yes**
Required, `ipref_time` must be provided and must be greater than 0. | | `iperf_port` | number | Defines the port number where the destination is listening for test connections. | **Yes**
Required, `ipref_port` must be provided and must be a valid port number. | | `multicast` | boolean | Specifies if the Ipref test will bind to a multicast group. | **Yes**
Required, `multicast` must be:
\- `true`
\- `false` | | `multicast_ip` | string | The IP address of the multicast group. | **Yes**
Required if `multicast` is `true`, must be a valid IP address. | | `ttl` | number | The ttl value for multicast tests. | **Yes**
Required, `ttl` must be provided and must be greater than 0. | | `tcp_window` | number | Specifies the TCP window size. | **Yes,**
Required if `ipref_type` is `1` `tcp_window` must be provided and must be greater than 0. | | `bandwidth` | number | Specifies the target bandwidth for the test. This represents the upper bound in Mbits/second (fractions allowed). | **Yes**
Optional, `bandwith` must be greater than 0. If `bandwidth` is not provided maximum bandwith with be used. If `ipref_version` is `2` then `bandwidth` will only be applied if `iperf_type` is `2`, otherwise maximum `bandwidth` is used. | | `tos` | number | Specifies the TOS flag for the packets. | **Yes**
Optional, can be one of the following values:
\- `32` (PRIORITY_CS1)
\- `40` (PRIORITY_AF11)
\- `48` (PRIORITY_AF12)
\- `56` (PRIORITY_AF13)
\- `64` (IMMEDIATE_CS2)
\- `72` (IMMEDIATE_AF21)
\- `80` (IMMEDIATE_AF22)
\- `88` (IMMEDIATE_AF23)
\- `96` (FLASH_CS3)
\- `104` (FLASH_AF31)
\- `112` (FLASH_AF32)
\- `120` (FLASH_AF33)
\- `128` (FLASH_OVERRIDE_CS4)
\- `136` (FLASH_OVERRIDE_AF41)
\- `144` (FLASH_OVERRIDE_AF42)
\- `152` (FLASH_OVERRIDE_AF43)
\- `160` (CRITICAL_CS5)
\- `184` (CRITICAL_EF)
\- `192` (INTER_NETWORK_CONTROL_CS6)
\- `224` (NETWORK_CONTROL_CS7) | | `data_size` | number | Specifies the datagram size for UDP tests. | **Yes**
Required if `ipref_type` is `2`, `data_size` must be provided and must be greater than 0. | | `target_is_agent` | number | Specifies the agent ID if the destination for this test is a NetBeez agent. | **Yes**
Optional if `agent` to `agent` Ipref test is desired, `target_is_agent` must be a valid `agent` `id`. | | `iperf_version` | number | Specifies the version number for the Iperf to be used. | **Yes**
Required, `ipref_version` must be one of the following values:
\- `2` (Ipref v2)
\- `3` (Ipref v3) | | `reverse` | boolean | Specifies if the test should be performed from the destination to the source. Generally used when the source cannot be reached by the destination. | **Yes**
Required, `reverse` must be one of the following options:
\- `true`
\- `false` | ### Network Speedtest | Attribute | Data Type | Description/Options | **User Defined?** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `speedtest_type` | number | Specifies the type of speedtest to be run. | **Yes**
Required, `speedtest_type` must be provided and must be one of the following values:
\- `2` (M-Lab NDT)
\- `3` (Netflix Fast.com) | | `secure` | boolean | Specifies if the traffic should be encrypted. | **Yes**
Required, `secure` must be provided and must be one of the following values:
\- `true`
\- `false` | ### VoIP | Attribute | Data Type | Description/Options | **User Defined?** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `codec` | string | Specifies the codec which the calls of this test should simulate. | **Yes**
Required, `codec` must be one of the following values:
\- `g711`
\- `g729`
\- `g723-63`
\- `g723-53`
\- `g726`
\- `g728-16`
\- `g722-64` | | `voip_time` | number | Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, each test iteration will run for. | **Yes**
Required, `voip_time` must be provided and must be greater than 0. | | `voip_port` | number | Defines the port number where the destination is listening for test connections. | **Yes**
Required, `voip_port` must be provided and must be a valid port number. | | `target_is_agent` | number | Specifies the agent ID if the destination for this test is a NetBeez agent. | **Yes**
Required,`target_is_agent` must provided and must be a valid `agent` `id`. | ### Relationships | **Relationship** | **One or Many** | **Options** | | --- | --- | --- | | `agents` | Many | **No** | | `monitoring_condition` | One | **Yes** | | `scheduled_test_condition` | One | **Yes** |

item.name: Speedtest Test
item.description:
Below are the `options` if the `nb_test` `test_type` is scheduled `speedtest`:

| Attribute | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `speedtest_type` | number | Specifies if the speedtest should use Ookla (1), NDT (2), or fast.com (3). | **No** |
| `secure` | boolean | Indicates if the speedtest should be done securely. | **No** |

item.name: Target
Target Template
item.description:
NetBeez gives you a simplified way of generating a target. Users will provide basic information and Netbeez will handle the rest of the configuration with pre-defined defaults. | Name | ID | Additional Configuration? | | --- | --- | --- | | Website | `website` | `name` : The name of the website that is used as the name of the target.
Required, `name` must be provided and must be less than 255 characters.

`url`: The URL that will be used for the test.
Required, `url` must be a valid URL.

`ping_test`: Defines if a ping test should also be configured.
Required, `ping_test` must be provided and must be one of the following values:
\- `true`
\- `false`

`jitter_and_mos_enabled`: Defines target tests should be also configured with jitter and MOS where applicable.
Required, `jitter_and_mos_enabled` must be provided and must be one of the following values:
\- `true`
\- `false` | | DNS | `dns` | `nameserver_ips`: Defines the list of nameserver IP addresses to be used.
Required, `nameserver_ip` must be provided and must be an array of valid ip addresses.

`fqdn`: Defines the FQDN in which the the `nameserver_ips` would be included in.
Required, `fqdn` must be provided and must be a valid FQDN.

`dns_type`: Defines if the test should use UDP or TCP.
Required, `dns_type` must be provided and must be one of the following values:
\- `2` (UDP)
\- `3` (TCP) | | VPN | `vpn` | `fqdn`: Defines an IP or FQDN that would be accessible through a VPN.
Required, `fqdn` must be provided and must be a valid IP address or FQDN.

`ping_interval`: Specifies how often a ping test should run for this target.
Required, `ping_interval` must be provided and must be an integer greater than 0. | | Gateway | `gateway` | `ping_interval`: Specifies how often a ping test should run for this target.
Required, `ping_interval` must be provided and must be an integer greater than 0. |

item.name: Saas Target
item.description:
NetBeez gives you an easy way to set up monitoring for popular SaaS platforms using the [/targets/saas](#request-e3fff930-f254-4188-b0b4-6e676fbb133d) endpoint. See below for available SaaS options. If SaaS has additional configuration see corresponding table below. | Name | ID | Additional Configuration? | | --- | --- | --- | | Five9 North America | five9_na | **No** | | Five9 Europe | five9_eu | **No** | | Five9 UK/Ireland | five9_uk | **No** | | Five9 Asia Pacific | five9_ap | **No** | | Five9 Australia | five9_aus | **No** | | Five9 South America | five9_sa | **No** | | Google Workspace | google_workspace | **No** | | Google Docs | google_docs | **No** | | Google Mail | google_mail | **No** | | Google Calendar | google_calendar | **No** | | Google Hangouts | google_hangouts | **No** | | Google Meet | google_meet | **No** | | Microsoft Office 364 Login | ms_office_365_login | **No** | | Microsoft Office 365 Applications | ms_office_365_app | **No** | | Microsoft SharePoint Base | sharepoint_base | **No** | | Microsoft SharePoint Tenant | sharepoint_tentant | **Yes**
`name` (String) must be a provided attribute. | | Microsoft Outlook | ms_outlook | **No** | | Microsoft Teams | ms_teams | **No** | | Salesforce Base | salesforce_base | **No** | | Salesforce My Domain | salesforce_my_domain | **Yes**
`name` (String) must be a provided attribute. | | HubSpot | hubspot | **No** | | Service Now | service_now | **Yes**
`name` (String) must be a provided attribute. | | Slack Base | slack_base | **No** | | Slack Team Workspace | slack_team_workspace | **Yes**
`name` (String) must be a provided attribute. | | Webex Base | webex_base | **No** | | Webex Tenant | webex_tenant | **Yes**
`name` (String) must be a provided attribute. | | Zoom Base | zoom_base | **No** | | Zoom Meeting | zoom_meeting | **Yes**
`name` (String) must be a provided attribute. | | 8x8 India | 8x8_india | **No** | | 8x8 Amsterdam | 8x8_amsterdam | **No** | | 8x8 Brazil | 8x8_brazil | **No** | | 8x8 Singapore | 8x8_singapore | **No** | | 8x8 West US | 8x8_west_us | **No** | | 8x8 East US | 8x8_east_us | **No** | | 8x8 UK | 8x8_uk | **No** | | 8x8 Australia | 8x8_australia | **No** | | 8x8 Hong Kong | 8x8_hong_kong | **No** |

A `target` represents a set of resources that need to be monitored as a unit. It consists of multiple `test_templates`. ### Attributes | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `created_at` | string | The timestamp of when the `target` was created. | **Yes**
Optional unless `report_type` is `scheduled_test`, if `scheduled_tests` is not provided the `agent` must provided and must be a valid `agent` `id`. | | `name` | string | User-defined attribute to help identify a `target`. | Yes
Required, must be no longer than 255 characters. | | `description` | string | User-defined attribute that gives the desired context to the `target`. | **Yes**
Optional, must be no longer than 255 characters. | | `smtp_notify` | boolean | Determines if aggregate alerts and incidents should be sent for this specific `target`. This overrides global `target` `aggregate_alert` and `incident` notification settings. SMTP notifications must be turned on globally. | **Yes**
Require, must be either `true` or `false`. | | `test_aggregate_counts_by_type` | object | | **No** | | `updated_at` | string | The timestamp of when the `target` was updated. | **No** | | `vpn_target` | boolean | | **Yes**
Required, must be `true` or `false` | | `wifi_test` | boolean | | **Yes**
Required, must be be `true` or `false` | | `wired_test` | boolean | | **Yes**
Required, must be be `true` or `false` | ### Relationships | Relationship | **One or Many** | **Optional?** | | --- | --- | --- | | `direct_agents` | Many | **Yes** | | `agent_group_agents` | Many | **Yes** | | `agent_groups` | Many | **Yes** | | `contacts` | Many | **Yes** | | `monitoring_condition` | One | **Yes** | | `open_incident` | One | **Yes** | | `test_templates` | Many | **No** |

item.name: Test Template
item.description:
A `test_template` describes a type of test and how it should be performed and alerted on, with the destination being a specific FQDN, IP address (and port, wherever is applicable) or URL (in the case of HTTP). ### Attribites | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `label` | string | A string to use for displaying the template. | **Yes**
If left empty the system will use the target field to display the template. | | `count` | number | The number of test runs to perform during the lifetime of this test. | **Yes**
This is generally used in ad-hoc tests so you may ignore it or set to `0` | | `interval` | number | Represents the number of seconds between two test runs. | **Yes**
Optional. The default depending on the test type is: { `ping`: `5`, `dns`: `10`, `http`: `60`, `traceroute`: `120`, `path_analysis`: `300` } | | `timeout` | number | Represents the number of seconds to wait before declaring a test as failed. | **Yes**
Optional. The default is 5 seconds. | | `target` | string | An IP address, FQDN or URL of the destination for the test. | **Yes**
Required. | The following paragraphs will describe test-type specific attributes that are included with the common attributes described above. #### Ping | Attributes | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `data_size` | number | Specifies the MTU size. | **Yes** | | `dont_fragment` | boolean | Specifies if provided MTU should be sent fragmented. | **Yes** | | `tos` | number | Specifies the TOS DSCP/PHB class. | **Yes** | | `port` | number | The indicated `port` the `ping_test` will use to connect to. | **Yes** | | `ping_type` | number | Indicates if the `ping_test` should use ICMP (2) or TCP (3). | **Yes** | | `flags` | string | If `ping_type` is set to TCP this field will specify set flags. | **Yes** | | `jitter_mos` | boolean | Indicates of `ping_test` should also calculate jitter and MOS scores. | **Yes** | | `force_ipv6` | boolean | If enabled the test will attempt to use only IPv6 addresses of the FQDN target's DNS resolution. Otherwise it will use whatever is available. | **Yes** | #### DNS | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `dns_server` | string | Specified DNS server address. | **Yes** | | `dns_type` | number | Indicates if the DNS test will be done via UDP (2) or TCP (3). | **Yes** | #### HTTP | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `http_method` | string | Indicates the HTTP method to be used. Currently only `GET` is supported. | **No** | | `proxy_protocol` | string | Specifies if HTTP or HTTPS will be used with the configured proxy. | **Yes** | | `proxy_address` | string | Specifies the proxy IP address or URL to be used for the `http_test`. | **Yes** | | `proxy_port` | string | Specifies the port the configured proxy can be reached on. | **Yes** | | `proxy_authentication_username` | string | The `username` to be used to authenticate with the proxy should the proxy require authentication. | **Yes** | | `proxy_authentication_password` | string | The `password` to be used to authenticate with the proxy should the proxy require authentication. | **Yes** | | `authentication_type` | string | Specifies optional authentication for specified `nb_test` `target`. Supported options are Basic and NTML. | **Yes** | | `authentication_username` | string | The `username` to be used to authenticate. | **Yes** | | `authentication_password` | string | The `password` to be used to authenticate. | **Yes** | #### Traceroute | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `hop_max` | number | Indicates the max number of hops allowed during the `traceroute_test`. | **Yes** | | `hop_timeout` | number | Specifies the timeout of each hop. | **Yes** | | `traceroute_type` | number | Indicates if the test will be done via UDP (1), ICMP (2), or TCP (3). | **Yes** | | `tos` | number | Specifies the TOS DSCP/PHB class. | **Yes** | | `port` | number | The indicated `port` the `traceroute_test` will use to connect to. | **Yes** | #### Path Analysis | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `num_flows` | number | Specifies the number of flows that will be done during the test. | **Yes** | | `source_port` | number | Specifies the port that should be used when performing the `path_anlaysis_test` from the `agent`. | **Yes** | | `destination_port` | number | The indicated `port` the `path_analysis_test` will use to connect to. | **Yes** | | `max_ttl` | number | Indicates the max number of hops to be attempted on each flow. | **Yes** | | `min_ttl` | number | Indicates the minimum number of hops to be attempted on each flow. | **Yes** | | `inter_packet_delay` | number | Specifies the number of milliseconds between each hop. | **Yes** | ### Relationships | Relationship | **One or Many** | **Optional?** | | --- | --- | --- | | `test_type` | One | **No** | | `alert_detectors` | Many | **Yes** |

item.name: Traceroute Results
item.description:
A `traceroute_result` consists of the following attributes:

| Attribute | Data Type | Description/Options | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `timestamp` | number | An epoch timestamp of when the test occurred. | **No** |
| `total_hops` | number | The number of total hops included in the result. | **No** |
| `hops` | object | The individual hop results. | **No** |

`hops` under a `traceroute_result` consists of the following attributes:

| Attribute | Data Type | Description/Options | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `hop_number` | number | The corresponding hop number is the `traceroute_result`. | **No** |
| `ip_address` | string | The `ip_address` reported by hop source. | **No** |
| `mtu` | number | The maximum transition unit of the hop. | **No** |
| `rtt` | number | The round trip time of the hop. | **No** |
| `domain` | string | The `domain` reported by hop source. | **No** |
| `error_message` | string | If any error message is encountered during a hop the error is recorded here. | **No** |

item.name: Traceroute Test
item.description:
Below are the `options` if the `nb_test` `test_type` is `traceroute`:

| Attribute | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `hop_max` | number | Indicates the max number of hops allowed during the `traceroute_test`. | **No** |
| `hop_timeout` | number | Specifies the timeout of each hop. | **No** |
| `traceroute_type` | number | Indicates if the test will be done via UDP (1), ICMP (2), or TCP (3). | **No** |
| `tos` | number | Specifies the TOS DSCP/PHB class. | **No** |
| `port` | number | The indicated `port` the `traceroute_test` will use to connect to. | **No** |

item.name: Transition State
item.description:
Transition all tests by using one of the following attributes. You must use one of the following.

| Attribute | Data Type | Description/Options | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `test_ids` | array | An array of the `nb_test_ids` that will be transitioned. | **No** |
| `agent_ids` | array | An array of the `agent_ids`. All `nb_tests` will be retrieved for list of `agents` provided and those `nb_tests` will then be transitioned. | **No** |
| `target_ids` | array | An array of the `target_ids`. All `nb_tests` will be retrieved for list of `targets` provided and those `nb_tests` will then be transitioned. | **No** |
| `wifi_profile_ids` | array | An array of the `wifi_profile_ids`. All `nb_tests` will be retrieved for list of `wifi_profiles` provided and those `nb_tests` will then be transitioned. |  |

item.name: VoIP Test
item.description:
Below are the `options` if the `nb_test` `test_type` is scheduled `voip_test`:

| Attribute | Data Type | Description | **User Defined?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `codec` | string | Indicates the codec used by the `voip_test`. | **No** |
| `voip_time` | number | Specifies the number of seconds the `voip_test` will run for. | **No** |
| `voip_port` | number | The indicated port the `voip_test` will use to connect to. | **No** |

item.name: WiFi Hopping Group
item.description:
A `wifi_hopping_group` represents a group of between 2 and 4 `wifi_profiles` in which a `wireless` `agent` will "hop" between at a given interval. ### Attributes | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `description` | string | User-defined attribute to help give more context to a `wifi_hopping_group`. | **Yes**
Optional, must be no longer than 255 characters. | | `interval_minutes` | number | The number of minutes for assigned `agents` of the `wifi_hopping_group` jump to an associated `wifi_profile`. | **Yes**
Required, must be one of the following values:
\- 2 `wifi_profiles`: 5, 10, 15, 30, 60, 120, 180, 240, 360
\- 3 `wifi_profiles`: 5, 10, 20, 60, 120, 240
\- 4 `wifi_profiles`: 5, 10, 15, 60, 120, 180, 360 | | `name` | string | User-defined attribute that describes the `wifi_hopping_group`. | **Yes**
Required, must be no longer than 255 characters. | | `processing` | string | Indicates if the `wifi_hopping_group` is still processing requested changes such as updates to assigned `agents` or `wifi_profiles`. | **No** | | `wifi_hopping_group_version` | number | Represents a version number for the current `wifi_hopping_group` configuration. | **No** | ### Relationships | Resource | One or Many | Optional? | | --- | --- | --- | | `agents` | Many | **Yes** | | `wifi_profiles` | Many | **No** |

item.name: WiFi Profile
item.description:
A `wifi_profile` represents a wireless network an `agent` can connect to. ### Attributes | Attribute | Data Type | Description | User Defined? | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `authentication_method` | string | The authentication protocol to be used when an `agent` connects to an `ssid`. | **Yes**
Optional, unless `encryption_methods` is `wpa-eap`, then one of the following values must be provided:
\- `eap-tls`
\- `eap-ttls`
\- `leap`
\- `peap` | | `ca_cert` | string | The CA Certificate to be used when an `agent` connects to an `ssid`. | **Yes**
Optional, unless `encryption_method` is `wpa-eap` and `authentication_method` is `eap-tls` or `eap-ttls`, then a certificate must be provided. | | `client_cert` | string | The certificate to be used when an `agent` connects to an `ssid`. | **Yes**
Optional, unless `encryption_method` is `wpa-eap` and `authentication_method` is `eap-tls`, then a certificate must be provided. | | `description` | string | User-defined attribute that gives the desired context to the `wifi_profile`. | **Yes**
Optional, must be no longer than 255 characters. | | `encryption_method` | string | The encryption to be used when an `agent` connects to an `ssid`. | **Yes**
Required, must be one of the following values:
\- `open`
\- `wep-64`
\- `wep-128`
\- `wep-256`
\- `wpa-psk`
\- `wpa-eap` | | `identity` | string | The logon/username to be used when an `agent` connects to an `ssid`. | **Yes**
Optional unless `encryption_method` is `wap-eap`, then a value must be provided. | | `interval_minutes` | number | If and how often `agents` should reconnect to the `ssid`. | **Yes**
Optional, must be one of the following values:
\- `null` (will not reconnect periodically)
\- `5`
\- `10`
\- `15`
\- `20`
\- `30`
\- `60`
\- `120`
\- `180`
\- `240`
\- `360` | | `network_verification_enabled` | boolean | Defines if a network test will be performed to determine if the `agent` is connected to the internet. | **Yes**
Required, should be either `true` or `false`. | | `network_verification_target` | string | The FQDN, URL, or IP address that will be used when performing the network test to determine if the `agent` is connected to the internet. | **Yes**
Optional unless `network_verification_enabled` is `true`, then a valid FQDN, URL, or IP address must be provided. | | `network_verification_test` | string | The type of network test that will be attempted based on the `network_verification_target`. | **Yes**
Optional unless `network_verification_enabled` is `true`, then one of the following values must be provided:
\- `http`
\- `ping` | | `password` | string | The password to be used when an `agent` connects to an `ssid`. | **Yes**
Optional, only applies when `encryption_method` is `wpa-eap`. | | `phase2` | string | The type of Phase 2 authentication to be used when an `agent` connects to an `ssid`. | **Yes**
Optional, only applies with `encryption_method` is `wpa-eap` and `authentication_method` is `eap-ttls`, then must be one of the following values:
\- `auth=MD5`
\- `auth=MSCHAPV2` | | `preshared_key` | string | The preshared key to be used when an `agent` connects to an `ssid`. | **Yes**
Required when `encryption_method` `wep-64`, `wep-128`, `wep-256`, or `wpa-psk`. | | `private_key` | string | The private key to be used when an `agent` connects to an `ssid`. This only applies when `encryption_method` is `wpa-eap` and `authentication_method` is `eap-tls`. | **Yes**
Required when`encryption_method` is `wpa-eap` and `authentication_method` is `eap-ttls`, then must be one of the following values:
\- `auth=MD5`
\- `auth=MSCHAPV2` | | `private_key_password` | string | The private key password to be used when an `agent` connects to an `ssid`. This only applies when `encryption_method` is `wpa-eap` and `authentication_method` is `eap-tls`. | **Yes**
Optional, only applies when `encryption_method` is `wpa-eap` and `authentication_method` is `eap-tls`. | | `ssid` | string | The `ssid` name of the WiFi network that an `agent` will connect to. | **Yes**
Rquiredand must be no longer than 32 characters. | ### Relationships | Resource | One or Many | Optional? | | --- | --- | --- | | `agents` | Many | **Yes** | | `open_incident` | One | **Yes** | | `nb_test_counters` | One | **No** | | `wifi_hopping_groups` | Many | **Yes** | | `wifi_hopping_group_agents` | Many | **Yes** |

item.name: POST/PUT using JSONAPI

item.description: Here you'll find reference information on the various data resources in NetBeez. Each resource will describe its attributes, attribute data types, description, and in some cases if the attribute is user defined and can be modified. We will also provide other relevant information when necessary.

item.name: Changelog
Version 14.0
item.description:
- **Agent APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - Agent index route can now be sorted by `open_incident`, such that all agents with an open incident will appear before / after agents without an incident
            - Within the two groups (agents with incident and agents without), the agents will be sorted by name, always ascending
- **Target APIs**
    
    - \[ADDED\]
        
        - Target index route can now be sorted by `open_incident`, such that all targets with an open incident will appear before / after targets without an incident
            
            - Within the two groups (targets with incident and targets without), the targets will be sorted by name, always ascending

item.name: Version 13.0
item.description:
_**Depreciations will be removed in version**__**`15.0`**__**, please update your integrations.**_

- **Agent APIs**
    - \[DEPRECIATED\]
        - _`open_incient_id`_ _will no longer be available as an_ _`Agent`_ _attribute and will instead be provided as a relationship. You can find if an_ _`Agent`_ _has an open incident via "relationships" -> "open_incident"._
        - _`wifi_profile_id`_ _will no longer be available as an_ _`Agent`_ _attribute and will instead be provided as a relationship. You can find if an_ _`Agent`_ _has a_ _`WifiProfile`_ _via "relationships" -> "wifi_profile" if the_ _`Agent`_ _is wireless._
        - _`wifi_hopping_group_id`_ _will no longer be available as an_ _`Agent`_ _attribute and will instead be provided as a relationship. You can find if an_ _`Agent`_ _has an open incident via "relationships" -> "wifi_hopping_group" if the_ _`Agent`_ _is wireless._

item.name: Version 12.0
item.description:
- **Incident APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Incidents_ can now be accessed with [GET `/incidents`](#request-4425180-11e2a36e-041f-4df5-b62d-cfae2f2cea2f) resource.
- **Test APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Scheduled Test Results_ can be filtered by `last_result` when using [GET `/scheduled_nb_test_templates/:scheduled_nb_test_template_id/results`](#request-4425180-36c50947-d258-40e7-ae8b-f6e2141ed90f) with `filter[last_result]` .

item.name: Version 11.0
item.description:
- **Agent APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - Include _Alerts_ when using [GET `/agents/:id/logs`](#09ca410e-c233-4013-a4b0-c0e876dfa9a5) with `included[alerts]` parameter.

item.name: Version 10.2
item.description:
- **Alert APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Alerts_ can now be accessed with [GET `/alerts`](#8ad44253-684b-495e-8900-56cd5ae1a0bf) resource.
- **Test APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _DNS Results_ can now be accessed with [GET `/nb_tests/dns/results`](#8ad44253-684b-495e-8900-56cd5ae1a0bf) resource.
        - _HTTP Results_ can now be accessed with [GET `/nb_tests/http/results`](#8ad44253-684b-495e-8900-56cd5ae1a0bf) resource.
        - _Ping Results_ can now be accessed with [GET `/nb_tests/ping/results`](#8ad44253-684b-495e-8900-56cd5ae1a0bf) resource.

item.name: Version 10.1
item.description:
- **Agent APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - Filter _Agents_ by `active_ts` when using [GET `/agents`](#4e9cf83e-805a-49e7-bc4e-56e31c064a6d) with `filter[active_ts]`.
- **Alert APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Alert Detectors_ can now be accessed with [GET `/alert_detectors`](#cdf20231-e255-4704-b86e-d3863cf00ead) resource.

item.name: Version 10.0
item.description:
- **Test APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - A single _NbTests_ can now resumed and paused when using [PUT `/nb_tests/:id/transition_states/:state`](#e417a7a8-c9db-42e1-8f56-8202fbdc1a16).
        - _NbTests_ can now resumed and paused for a list of _Agents_, _Targets_, or _WiFi Profiles_ when using [PUT `/nb_tests/transition_states/:state`](#e417a7a8-c9db-42e1-8f56-8202fbdc1a16).

item.name: Version 9.2
item.description:
- **Agent APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Agents_ can now be deleted using [DEL \`/agents\`](#4e9cf83e-805a-49e7-bc4e-56e31c064a6d).
        - _Access Point Connections_ can be filtered by `error_state` when using [GET `/agents/:agent_id/access_point_connections`](#977f4f35-0170-4b74-a9d5-0dd25a5a5000) with `filter[error_states]` .

item.name: Version 9.0
item.description:
_**Depreciations will be removed in**_ _**`12.0`**__**, please use renamed filters.**_

- **Agent APIs**
    - \[DEPRECATED\]
        - When using [GET `/agents`](#4e9cf83e-805a-49e7-bc4e-56e31c064a6d), `filter[status]` has been renamed to `filter[active]`.
        - When using [GET `/agents`](#4e9cf83e-805a-49e7-bc4e-56e31c064a6d), `filter[agent_class]` has been renamed to `filter[agent_classes]`.
        - When using [GET `/agents`](#4e9cf83e-805a-49e7-bc4e-56e31c064a6d), `filter[category]` has been renamed to `filter[categories].`
- **Report APIs**

        - When using [GET `/generated_reports`](#2b2dbecb-43de-4a15-9467-08e96c3c748a), `filter[report_type]` has been renamed to `filter[report_types]`.
- **Test APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _NbTests_ can now be accessed with [/nb_tests](#folder-f0e65e29-1638-4e7e-885b-c5a260d46ef6) resource.
    - \[DEPRECATED\]
        - When using [GET `/scheduled_nb_test_templates`](#b48585af-ddff-422e-9b52-af1b75399631), `filter[test_type_id]` has been renamed to `filter[test_types]`.
        - When using [GET `/nb_tests/traceroutes/results`](#75523d97-4591-41fd-97a5-c8352d80740b), `filter[nb_test_templates]` has been renamed to `filter[test_templates]`.

item.name: Version 8.0
item.description:
- **TEST APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Path Analysis Results_can now be accessed with[GET`/nb_tests/path_analysis/results`](#b130d31c-488d-44b5-9efa-f32694d39b63)resource.

item.name: Version 7.2
item.description:
- **Test APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Traceroute Results_can now be accessed with[GET`/nb_tests/traceroutes/results`](#75523d97-4591-41fd-97a5-c8352d80740b)resource.

item.name: Version 7.0
item.description:
- **Agent APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Agents_can now be accessed with[GET`/agents`](#4e9cf83e-805a-49e7-bc4e-56e31c064a6d)resource.
        - _Agent Groups_can now be accessed with[GET`/agent_groups`](#72f8008d-9140-4416-adee-d097d56cb07c)resource.

item.name: Version 5.0
item.description:
- **Report APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Generated Reports_can now be accessed with[GET`/reports/generated_reports`](#2b2dbecb-43de-4a15-9467-08e96c3c748a)resource.
- **Test APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Scheduled Test Results_can now be accessed with[GET`/scheduled_nb_test_templates/:id/results`](#6284ccf0-f48b-437c-92c9-10a3374184ac)resource.
        - _Scheduled Test Result Statistics_can now be accessed with[GET`/scheduled_nb_test_templates/:id/results/statistics`](#01a9804d-356a-4687-b64e-6579f78fab36)resource.
        - _Scheduled Test Templates_can now be accessed with[GET`/scheduled_nb_test_templates`](#b48585af-ddff-422e-9b52-af1b75399631)resource.
- **WiFi APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _WiFi Profiles_can now be accessed with[GET`/wifi_profiles`](#9c7f897b-1dfb-459d-9d9d-954671187973)resource.

item.name: Version 4.0
item.description:
- **Agent APIs**
    - \[ADDED\]
        - _Agent Logs_can now be accessed with[GET`/agents/:id/logs`](#09ca410e-c233-4013-a4b0-c0e876dfa9a5)resource.
        - _Access Point Connections_can now be accessed with[GET`/agents/:agent_id/access_point_connections`](#977f4f35-0170-4b74-a9d5-0dd25a5a5000)resource.

item.name: Depreciation Notice for V1
item.description: As of 4.0, the V1 version of our API is deprecated. The V1 version will continue to receive support for bug fixes but will not receive any further enhancements. This is to allow us to focus our efforts on expanding our new API offering to our customers introduced in 4.0. The V1 version will continue to exist until we have released comparable functionality through our new API. During this time customers who have deployed public dashboards will not notice any changes in functionality and they will continue to work as expected.
The Changelog details changes made to NetBeez API functionality. Changes for each version of NetBeez can be found below.
